Hello everyone, my name is ZHU Haoyu, and I am currently a third-year undergraduate student majoring in mathematics. My journey in algebra began in my sophomore year with an introduction to group theory, ring theory, and a bit of field theory. In the following semester, I studied commutative algebra and representation theory, including Lie algebras and an introduction to Coxeter groups. More recently, I explored cluster algebras, their connections to quiver representations and cluster categories, and the theory of quantum cluster algebras, under the instruction of professor Huang Min. I am eager to engage with cutting-edge research. Last summer, I collaborated with researchers at Peking University on Bottâ€“Samelson rings for Coxeter groups. We provided explicit presentations of these rings using generators and relations and discovered interesting combinatorial properties. Currently, I am studying the correspondence between skein algebras and quantum cluster algebras of $\mathfrak{sl_2}$, aiming to extend these results to stated skein algebras and other semisimple Lie algebras. I enjoy learning mathematics with others. Hosting and participating in seminars allows me to exchange ideas with peers, as I believe discussion and collaboration are key to deepening our understanding and gaining new insights. Thank you!2025/03/02
